io.artframework

Interface Trigger

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ArtObject, ResultCreator, Scoped, TargetCreator

    public interface Trigger
extends ArtObject, Scoped, TargetCreator, ResultCreator
    A Trigger is used to trigger actions and check requirements. Use this interface to mark your classes that contain trigger.

    For every trigger you need to have a method that is annotated with ART and provide the same unique identifier you used in the annotation in the trigger method call.

    Make sure that you register your Trigger with the TriggerProvider.

      • scope

        default Scope scope()
        Override this and provide your own configuration instance if you are deriving from the global scope.
        Specified by:
        scope in interface Scoped
        Returns:

      • trigger

        default CombinedResult trigger(java.lang.String identifier,
                               TriggerTarget<?>... targets)
        Triggers a trigger with the given identifier and trigger targets.

        You can also use the other trigger(...) methods that will automatically wrap your targets into a TriggerTarget.

        Parameters:
        identifier - the unique identifier of the trigger
        targets - the targets this trigger affects
        Returns:
        the result of the trigger

      • trigger

        default CombinedResult trigger(java.lang.String identifier,
                               java.lang.Object... targets)
        Triggers a trigger with the given identifier and targets.

        You can also use the other trigger(...) methods that will automatically wrap your targets into a TriggerTarget.

        Parameters:
        identifier - the unique identifier of the trigger
        targets - the targets this trigger affects
        Returns:
        the result of the trigger

      • trigger

        default <TTarget,TConfig> CombinedResult trigger(java.lang.String identifier,
                                                 java.lang.Class<TConfig> configClass,
                                                 TriggerRequirement<TTarget,TConfig> requirement,
                                                 TTarget... targets)
        Triggers the given trigger applying the same config predicate to all trigger targets.
        Type Parameters:
        TTarget - type of the target
        TConfig - type of the config
        Parameters:
        identifier - the unique identifier of the trigger
        configClass - the config class to use in the predicate
        requirement - the predicate that should be tested before applying to the trigger to the targets
        targets - the targets this trigger applies to
        Returns:
        the result of the trigger

      • of

        default <TTarget,TConfig> java.util.Optional<TriggerTarget<TTarget>> of(TTarget target,
                                                                        java.lang.Class<TConfig> configClass,
                                                                        TriggerRequirement<TTarget,TConfig> requirement)
        Creates a new trigger target from the given target with a predicate that is checked for this target.

        Make sure you use the target provided by the predicate method and not the one in your current scope.

        Type Parameters:
        TTarget - type of the target
        TConfig - type of the config
        Parameters:
        target - the target to wrap
        configClass - the config class
        requirement - the predicate to check before applying the trigger to the target
        Returns:
        the result of the trigger
